it
Class PointShape

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--it.PointShape
Direct Known Subclasses:
CirclePoint, CrossPoint, NoPoint, SquarePoint, TrianglePoint
public abstract class PointShape
extends java.lang.Object

This abstract class is the super-class for all point markers for a graph. To derive a new point marker for a graph inherit from this class and the method drawPoint must be implemented.

Method Detail

setSize

public void setSize(int w,
                    int h)
The bounding box dimensions of the point can be specified here. Warning - excessively large point markers may make a graph unreadable.

setStyle

protected void setStyle(byte s)
The style of either FILLED or UNFILLED can be set with this method.

drawPoint

public abstract void drawPoint(java.awt.Graphics g,
                               int x,
                               int y)
All sub-classes must supply a drawPoint method so that the point can be drawn to the canvas at location (x,y).
Parameters:
g - the graphics context to draw to
x - the x co-ordinate of the point's centre
y - the y co-ordinate of the point's centre
